Kup:

Kup smiled back and waited for more news

--------------------------------------------------
From: "Preston Carroll" <supercyclonus@...>
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 2010 11:26 AM
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: Into the Darkness

> The trip through the tunnel is relatively straight, with only very
> slight turns here and there as the rather large miussile truck revs
> its engines and pushes its way through, leaving behind the insectile
> creatures as well as the two sweeps that had been captured by them as
> well.
> 
> As Quickstride and Straightstride try to pull off the sticky cable the
> realize that the cable is more than stuck to Rodimus, but its actually
> attatced. In fact Rodimus' form cannot be truly seen, as he's covered
> head to foot in them, however every scan confirms that he is indeed in
> there somewhere. Scans also reveal that although he is healthy, he is
> undergoiong his own ordeal, something left over from the insects. Time
> is of the essence to get him back and repaired.
> 
> As the party makes it way back to the Ark they can hear several
> explosions behind them, the walls rumbling around them but so far
> nothing seems to inhibit their travel.
> 
> Meanwhile back at the Ark Lord Elder was there at the headquarters,
> apparently he had not taken any time for rest or even to eat, instead
> he manned the communicatyion station waiting for any word.
> 
> "We read you Tuscon!" Elder said as the call came in. "We will have
> medical staff standing by when you get here." Elder manipulated a few
> controls as he spoke, "and the shield is up and waiting for your
> entrance."
> 
> Elder turned back to Kup and just smiled broadly, "They're alive!" he
> said, nearly leaping out his chair with happniness.
> 
> It takes Tuscon hours of driving, but finally Tuscon arrives at an
> opening, a final break in the long monotony of near featureless
> smoothly tunneled walls. They at long last arrive at an opening to a
> rather deep pit.
> 
> The pit is very deep and very dark and it seems to go on for a very
> long time. It is roughly 8-10 feet and looking down it runs nearly
> straight down into the depths of the earth; even with artificial
> light, its end point cannot be seen as it continued into the darkness
> below. However looking up, several hundred feet up a tiny pinprick of
> light can be seen, it is the surface! However to reach the top one
> would need to be able to fly or have extremely good climbing
> abilities, as there are no hand holds and not even a single plant
> breaks the surface of the walls lining this area, the sides are
> extremely smooth and sheer,
> almost as if someone had cut it with some sort of high energy beam. .
> 
> From beneath Tuscon's position heat and noxious fumes rise from below,
> clearly show the danger of failing to climb or fly properly and
> plunging into the super heated depths. It would be a grizzly end
> indeed.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
